item.title: 'Rs 2,026cr loss to exchequer': BJP targets AAP over CAG report on 'liquorgate' - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP Criticizes Kejriwal Over CAG Report on Liquor Scandal

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

The BJP has launched a strong attack on Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal following a CAG report that alleges a loss of Rs 2,026 crore in a liquor policy scandal. The AAP dismisses these claims as 'fake.'

  • The CAG report indicates significant financial discrepancies in the liquor policy.
  • BJP leaders accuse Kejriwal's government of corruption and mismanagement.
  • AAP's representatives have vehemently rejected the allegations, labeling them a political ploy.
“These claims are absurd and fabricated. We will not be deterred by BJP's smear campaign.” - AAP Spokesperson

This ongoing political tussle highlights the contentious relationship between BJP and AAP amid serious allegations of financial misconduct.

item.title: BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - Start - SarkariExam.com
item.description:
BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - Start

Date: January 11, 2025   |   Source: Bihar School Examination Board, Patna

Short Information: Bihar School Examination Board, Patna (BSEB) has invited application for the Diploma In Elementary Education (D.El.Ed) Admission 2025. Online Registration Process for BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 has started from 11 January 2025 & the candidates can apply till 22 January 2025. Candidates must check the complete details for BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 which is given below.

Important Dates

  • Notification Date: 11 January 2025
  • Application Start Date: 11 January 2025
  • Last Date: 22 January 2025
  • Fee Payment Last Date: 22 January 2025
  • Correction Date: Notify Later
  • Exam Date: Notify Soon
  • Admit Card: Before Exam

Application Fee

  • General, EWS, BC, EBC: Rs. 960/-
  • SC, ST, Divyang: Rs. 760/-
  • Fee payment can be made through Debit Card, Credit Card, Net Banking, UPI, and other modes.

Age Limit

  • Minimum Age: 17 Years
  • Maximum Age: NA Years
  • Age Relaxation as per BSEB rules.

Educational Qualification

  • Candidates must have passed their Intermediate (Class 12th) examination with at least 50% marks (General/OBC) & 45% marks (SC/ST) from a recognized board.

How To Apply

  • Candidates can apply through the official site of the BSEB before the last date.

Mode of Selection

  • Selection will be based on online or written entrance examination.

Conclusion: The BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission application process has begun, and interested candidates are encouraged to apply before the deadline.

item.title: Thousands of devotees flock to Ayodhya for Ram Lalla idol consecration anniversary - The Times of India
item.description:
Thousands of devotees flock to Ayodhya for Ram Lalla idol consecration anniversary

Publication Date: N/A Source: The Times of India

Devotees from various parts of India have gathered in Ayodhya to celebrate the anniversary of the consecration of the Ram Lalla idol.

  • Thousands of devotees participated in the celebrations.
  • Significant religious and cultural sentiments associated with the event.
  • The event attracts people from across states, reflecting the religious diversity.
“This is a moment of great devotion and faith for all of us.”

The event showcases the deep-rooted religious significance for millions and strengthens the cultural identity among attendees.

item.title: 'Symbol of loot': BJP releases spoof video to target AAP on 'Sheesh Mahal' - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP Targets AAP with Spoof Video on 'Sheesh Mahal'

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has released a humorous spoof video aimed at the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) regarding the controversial 'Sheesh Mahal'. This video seeks to highlight alleged corruption within the AAP government.

  • The spoof video has gone viral, drawing attention to the BJP's criticisms of AAP's governance.
  • The video depicts exaggerated portrayals of AAP leaders and their policies.
  • It reflects ongoing political tensions between the BJP and AAP in Delhi.
“This video is a reminder of the accountability that all parties must uphold.” - BJP spokesperson

The release of this video indicates the intensifying political rivalry as both parties prepare for upcoming elections.

item.title: Assam reports first HMPV case this season as 10-month-old child tests positive in Dibrugarh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Assam has reported its first case of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection this season, with a 10-month-old child testing positive. The infant is currently undergoing treatment at Assam Medical College and Hospital (AMCH) in Dibrugarh and is said to be stable.

  • Ten-month-old child tests positive for HMPV in Dibrugarh, Assam.
  • Child admitted to AMCH with cold-related symptoms four days ago.
  • HMPV infection confirmed by ICMR-RMRC Lahowal after routine tests.
  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild symptoms.
  • Similar HMPV cases reported in Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu.
“The HMPV infection was confirmed yesterday after we got test results from Lahowal-based ICMR-RMRC. The child is stable now. It is a common virus, and there is nothing to worry about.” - Dr. Dhrubajyoti Bhuyan, AMCH superintendent

The detection of HMPV is not unusual, as the virus circulates seasonally and typically impacts infants and individuals with weaker immune systems more severely.

item.title: Train to Kashmir will start very soon: Ashwini Vaishnaw - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Train Services to Kashmir Set to Launch Soon, Says Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

Date: January 11 | Source: Chennai

Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw has announced that the long-anticipated train service connecting Jammu and Kashmir will commence shortly.

  • The project involves a 111-kilometre railway line, mostly consisting of tunnels and bridges.
  • A special Vande Bharat train has been designed to operate in extreme weather conditions.
  • A successful speed trial was conducted in recent inspections, paving the way for the launch.
“This is a highly complex project and the dream has now been fulfilled.”

This project marks a significant achievement in India’s railway sector, aiming to enhance connectivity and support regional development.

item.title: Congress's ‘damage control’ dig at PM Narendra Modi's ‘I am not a God’ comment in Nikhil Kamath's podcast - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Critiques PM Modi's Podcast Remarks on Being Human

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast, PM Narendra Modi stated that he is human and can make mistakes, a claim met with skepticism from Congress leader Jairam Ramesh, who accused the Prime Minister of engaging in damage control due to his previous assertion of being 'non-biological'.

  • Modi acknowledged his humanity and capacity for mistakes during a podcast with Nikhil Kamath.
  • Ramesh's critique refers to Modi's earlier statement on his 'non-biological' status made just months prior.
  • Modi emphasized the need for idealism in politics over strict ideological adherence.
“This from a man who proclaimed his non-biological status just eight months back. This is clearly damage control.” - Jairam Ramesh

The exchange highlights ongoing tensions between Congress and the ruling party regarding Modi's leadership narrative.

item.title: Ludhiana West AAP MLA Gogi died of accidental firing from own pistol: Police - The Tribune India
item.description:
Ludhiana West AAP MLA Gurpreet Bassi Gogi Dies from Accidental Firing

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Tribune

According to police, Gurpreet Bassi Gogi, an Aam Aadmi Party leader and MLA, died due to an accidental gunshot wound from his own licensed pistol. The incident took place at his residence.

  • The incident occurred around midnight on Friday when Gogi was struck by a bullet that pierced his temple.
  • He was rushed to Dayanand Medical College and Hospital (DMCH), where he was declared dead.
  • Family members reported it was an accidental firing.
  • Gogi is survived by his wife, son, and daughter.
  • Several political leaders expressed their condolences, including Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann.
  • Prior to his death, Gogi had participated in meetings about local issues and was active in his constituency.
“Got the sad news of the demise of our party's respected MLA from Ludhiana West Gurpreet Gogi ji. I am very sad to hear this. Heartfelt condolences to the family in this hour of grief.” - Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann

The police are currently investigating the incident, and a post-mortem examination will be conducted.

item.title: 6 arrested after Kerala Dalit girl claims she was sexually abused by 62 people over 5 years - The Indian Express
item.description:
6 Arrested After Kerala Dalit Girl Claims She Was Sexually Abused by 62 People Over 5 Years

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: Indian Express

The Kerala Police have arrested six individuals following allegations from an 18-year-old Dalit girl in Pathanamthitta district, who reported that approximately 62 individuals sexually abused her over the course of five years.

  • The girl was identified after volunteers from the Kerala Mahila Samakhya Society visited her during a field trip.
  • Pathanamthitta Superintendent of Police V G Vinod Kumar confirmed that the cases were lodged in two separate police stations.
  • In total, five arrests were made in one case, and one suspect was detained in another.
  • Advocate N Rajeev stated that the girl had undergone counseling and revealed her experiences to a psychologist.
  • Many of the alleged perpetrators were identified through contacts in her father's mobile phone.
The girl has been shifted to a shelter under the CWC, considering her protection.

This situation highlights the urgent need for vigilance and protection for vulnerable individuals, especially within the context of sexual abuse cases.

item.title: Su-57, F-35 ‘Clash’ At Indian Air Show? Russia To Debut Its Stealth Fighter in India; Putin May Renew Pitch To IAF - EurAsian Times
item.description:
Russia Debuts Su-57 Fighter at Indian Air Show; Potential Clash with F-35

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Eurasian Times

The Russian Su-57 stealth fighter will make its debut at the Aero India airshow, coinciding with speculations of F-35 fighter jets' presence. President Putin may renew his pitch to bolster India's fighter strength.

  • The Su-57 is Russia's first new fighter jet since the Cold War, aimed to compete with the US F-35.
  • Putin’s renewed offer could include improvements in stealth and combat capabilities.
  • India operates over 250 Su-30MKIs and may explore co-production under the “Make in India” initiative.
  • Challenges remain due to design delays and production issues influenced by Western sanctions.
  • The collaboration for the Su-57 was initially planned in 2007 but faced setbacks over the years.
“The Su-57 will be armed with beyond-visual-range missiles and is designed to destroy various targets.”

This event signifies a crucial moment in Indo-Russian defense relations, emphasizing collaborative advancements in military technology.

item.title: As Dhananjay Munde row continues to spiral in Maharashtra, BJP keeps a watch, Delhi takes note - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maharashtra Political Turmoil: Calls for Dhananjay Munde's Resignation Intensify

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Indian Express

The recent surrender of Walmik Kharad, an aide to NCP Minister Dhananjay Munde, in a murder case has sparked political upheaval in Maharashtra, with mounting pressure for Munde's resignation and scrutiny of the investigation.

  • The Maharashtra CID and a Special Investigation Team are currently handling the murder case of Massajog sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh.
  • Opposition parties are questioning the delay in Kharad's surrender and the status of another accused still at large.
  • BJP MLA Suresh Dhas is vocal about demanding Munde's resignation.
  • Munde has faced allegations of coercion regarding a land sale, further complicating his position.
  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis stated that all involved in the crime will be punished, with ongoing investigations expected to reveal more.
  • The BJP leadership is monitoring the situation closely, with factors from coalition politics influencing potential actions against Munde.
  • Maratha-OBC tensions are heightened, as activists call for demonstrations if justice is not served in the murder case.
“We will hold demonstrations across Maharashtra till justice is given to the sarpanch’s family members.” – Manoj Jarange Patil

This political saga reflects the complexities within Maharashtra's coalition government and shows how interconnected issues of crime and caste politics can affect leadership stability.

item.title: Ram Temple’s 1st anniversary to be celebrated on January 11, not on January 22. Here's why - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Ram Temple to Celebrate 1st Anniversary on January 11, 2025

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust has announced that the first anniversary of the Ram Mandir 'Pran Pratishtha' will be celebrated on January 11, 2025, in accordance with Hindu tradition, rather than on January 22, the date of last year’s consecration ceremony.

  • The temple trust follows Hindu calendar traditions for festival celebrations.
  • January 11, 2025, corresponds to the Hindu calendar date of Paush Shukla Paksh Dwadshi.
  • The decision was made after consultations with various saints.
  • The annual celebration will be referred to as Pratishtha Dwadashi.
“After consultation with saints, it was resolved that, in keeping with the tradition of observing Hindu festivals and celebrations according to the Hindu calendar (Panchang), the anniversary of the Pran Pratishtha of Prabhu Shri Ramlalla Sarkar will be celebrated annually on Paush Shukla Dwadashi.”

This decision emphasizes the connection of the celebration with Hindu culture and the importance of adhering to traditional practices.

item.title: Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and rain forecasted as dense fog disrupts flights and trains - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Delhi Weather Update: Thunderstorms and Rain Forecast as Fog Disrupts Services

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Delhi experienced dense fog and cold wave conditions, affecting flights and train services significantly.

  • Over 100 flights were delayed at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to low visibility.
  • The IMD issued a yellow alert predicting thunderstorms and rain.
  • Fog visibility in Delhi and surrounding areas was less than 50 meters in some regions.
Visibility reduced to zero as a blanket of dense fog witnessed in parts of Delhi-NCR.

The weather conditions are expected to continue impacting travel and air quality.

item.title: Wife Can Claim Maintenance From Husband Even If She Doesn't Live With Him As Per Decree On Conjugal... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Rules Wife Can Claim Maintenance Without Residing with Husband

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Law

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court stated that a wife is entitled to claim maintenance even if she refuses to live with her husband, despite a decree of restitution of conjugal rights.

  • The Court highlighted that a husband cannot deny maintenance simply because his wife does not live with him.
  • The ruling stemmed from a case where the wife suffered mistreatment and a miscarriage, justifying her refusal to return to the matrimonial home.
  • The husband's argument that the wife’s non-compliance with the decree exempted him from paying maintenance was rejected by the Court.
  • The Court emphasized that Section 125 Cr.P.C. exists to prevent destitution and applies regardless of marital disputes.
“Dinesh's attempts to evade responsibility clearly reflect a lack of bona fides,” the Court observed.

The Supreme Court reversed the Jharkhand High Court’s earlier decision, reaffirming the right of the wife to maintenance.

item.title: Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital - News18
item.description:
Pregnant Woman Dies, 5 Critical After Being Injected 'Expired' Saline At Midnapore Hospital

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: News18

A tragic incident at Midnapore Medical College and Hospital involves the administration of expired saline, leading to the death of a pregnant woman and critically ill conditions for five others.

  • A 10-member inquiry committee from the West Bengal Health Department will investigate the incident.
  • The health department has ordered the replacement of the current saline stock.
  • The deceased, Mamoni Rui Das (21), had given birth shortly before her condition deteriorated.
  • Opposition parties criticized the state government over the incident, demanding accountability.
“Shame on the crumbling healthcare system in West Bengal under the disastrous regime of @MamataOfficial! A pregnant woman DIED after being given EXPIRED saline at a govt hospital in Midnapore, and several others now fight for their lives.” — BJP West Bengal

This incident raises significant concerns about healthcare standards in West Bengal, demanding immediate governmental accountability and reform.

item.title: Assam mine tragedy: 2nd body recovered as rescue ops enters 6th day - The Times of India
item.description:
Assam mine tragedy: 2nd body recovered as rescue ops enters 6th day

Date: [Insert publication date] Source: [Insert source]

Rescue operations continue in Assam following a tragic mine accident that has now entered its sixth day. The efforts have led to the recovery of a second body.

  • Second body recovered during ongoing rescue operations.
  • Rescue efforts have faced challenges due to difficult terrain.
  • Families of the victims are awaiting news and support.
“We are working tirelessly to recover all trapped miners,” said a rescue official.

The recovery of bodies, while tragic, highlights the urgent need for safety reforms in mining operations in the region.
